artist: Frank Lloyd Wright Attributed to John W. Ayers
creditline: Gift of Ruth L. and Walter Swardenski
image_copyright: Â©2001 Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
medium: Oak, plant fiber cushion fill, replacement cloth upholstery
text: It would have been easier to read the newspaper in this Wright-designed easy chair than in his tall-back chairs in this gallery. Wright designed it for the first house he built for Francis W. Little. Though overwhelmingly rectilinear, the chair does have cushions and an adjustable back for reclining at different angles.
title: Easy chair
